TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
> 
> ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) The Bob/Tedus banter is so fun I find myself hoping they don't get rescued too soon...

Even if they do, I think I can contrive to have them share a Mk2 cockpit again in the future ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Someone really should smack Mort in the head with a hard drive, while shouting "FOR SCIENCE!".

> 
> Aww...I like Mort better as a plucky over-worked stressed-out money manager barely trying to hold the space program together with duct tape and underhanded contracts dealings.

Yeah, me too, but sometimes you need somebody to 'turn heel' for a while...hm, maybe I could borrow a page from Parkaboy and SaturnianBlue and make the Mort in E:O0 some kind of Mirror Mirror version, complete with mustache! But then I'd have to explain where Mort Prime went, and there'd be portals and wibbly wobbly stuff and well those guys are better at that than I am so I guess I'll just go with what I've got.

> 
> I thought the Prime Directive was noninterference with other cultures and civilizations.

I think you must have us confused with some other space program. We never installed the "other cultures" mod. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I am thoroughly geeking out at the use of Fizbin as an actual game.
Why not just send them a probe loaded ith endless TV reruns, loads of board games, a small Hab and an antannae?
Just send TVTropes. But wait...what if E:O0 is used to keep them occupied?

> 
> G.O. #1 = NEEDS\_MANYKERBS >>> NEEDS\_FEWKERBS

So, you're making a new variable G.O. #1 and its value is NEEDS\_MANYKERBS (probably a constant) bitshifted by NEEDS\_FEWKERBS?

![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

This actually came to me before I managed to figure out the real message. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Why not just send them a probe loaded ith endless TV reruns, loads of board games, a small Hab and an antannae?

Because if he did that, E:O0 would probably turn into Bob and Tedus' sitcom. But I would totally read that.

![thCCjRe.png](http://i.imgur.com/thCCjRe.png)

![ytLomh4.png](http://i.imgur.com/ytLomh4.png)

I can't remember whether a Kerbal dropping from that height on Kerbin will survive or not... hey, maybe we'll all find out together!
Last I checked a Kerbal can survive a drop from the VAB top so yes he will survive. I think.
Kerbals die at collisions 40m/s or over IIRC, so you'd be better off jumping from the VAB, or to make it cooler from atop the SPH tower.

> 
> Kerbals die at collisions 40m/s or over IIRC, so you'd be better off jumping from the VAB, or to make it cooler from atop the SPH tower.

Jeb liked the visual of jumping from the Kerbfleet flag. He's making a statement ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I've dropped kerbals higher than that and they survived.

There's a chance of the Hell Kraken hitting you though.

Boooooooooooo!

Hissssssssss!

Down with evil Mort!

Boooooooooooooooo

If kerbfleet's General Order One is that the needs of many kerbals outweight the needs of few, I wonder what is the General Order *Zero*... I'm almost sure it isn't "Don't let Jeb jump from the flagpole"...
Wait, is it just some strange casual training or he will be like so ded?![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> Jeb liked the visual of jumping from the Kerbfleet flag. He's making a statement ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Wow is he ever!

I love that you keep surprising me.

Mort's smile looks so evil. I never noticed that before.

Happy landings!

Well, I can see Jeb getting fired from a mile away. His track record isn't exactly shiny.

As for his jump, I've had Kerbals jump out of a doomed plane from 1,000 metres up, hit the water limp, and survive.
once bob felt from 6km and survived, why woudnt jeb?
Hmm... Jeb's "jump" could be part of Bill's plan...

> 
> Hmm... Jeb's "jump" could be part of Bill's plan...

How much time it takes to get a vehicle on the pad (or just out of wherever it is in since it doesn't really need pad) and fuel it?

Year, right, now I can imagine simultaneous liftoff of both vehicles.

Another question: even if M7 can SSTO from Kerbin, it'll probably need refueling in LKO to get to EVE... Kranefly? or does "Mortingale? have extra?

> 
> Another question: even if M7 can SSTO from Kerbin, it'll probably need refueling in LKO to get to EVE... Kranefly? or does "**Mortingale**? have extra?

I believe you mean the Billmobile. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Happy landings!

Well, it's not a cliffhanger, more of a Poleclimber.

Can't wait to see what happens!

I've had Jeb survive dropping from orbit, before 1.0.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-09T20:20:29Z" title="09/09/2015 08:20  PM" data-short="8 yr">September 9, 2015</time> by Mad Rocket Scientist**

Well, you'll be glad to here the post above was my 1,000th post.

Oops. I was saving that.

Oh well.

> 
> Another question: even if M7 can SSTO from Kerbin, it'll probably need refueling in LKO to get to EVE... Kranefly? or does "Mortingale? have extra?

 Correct, it can just drag itself to LKO. Then it would need to be either towed or refueled. Love that you guys know what I have available up there to help almost as well as I do.

> 
> I've had survive dropping from orbit, before 1.0.

Yeesh, so much for dramatic tension. You guys are tough! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) Oh well, may as well hang a lampshade on it... 

> 
> Can't wait to see what happens!

Wait no more!

![gWYosQc.png](http://i.imgur.com/gWYosQc.png)

![eGW0iAl.png](http://i.imgur.com/eGW0iAl.png)

> 
> Hmm... Jeb's "jump" could be part of Bill's plan...

 Good call! Unfortunately it's rather hard to hide Size 3 parts, even with Jeb soliloquizing. Tune in next time!
The REAL danger is the Hell Kraken, I've had it hit from a far lower distance off the ground.
